messages.subject: Re: principles versus rules
messages.msgSnippet: Just jumping in the middle here, so the book Living Joyfully With Children by Win Sweet may have already been posted. It talks about preserving the emotional
messages.messageBody:
Just jumping in the middle here, so the book Living Joyfully With
Children by Win Sweet may have already been posted. It talks about
preserving the emotional integrity of the child and the value of
principle based family dynamics.

Pat
--- In UnschoolingDiscussion@yahoogroups.com, Elizabeth Hill
<ecsamhill@e...> wrote:
>
> ** does anyone have further reading on the principles versus
rules?<<<
>
> There'll be a whole presentation about them at the upcoming Live &
Learn
> Unschooling Conference in Peabody, MA August 27-29, 2004.
>
> _www.liveandlearnconference.org_
(http://www.liveandlearnconference.org)
> <http://www.liveandlearnconference.org%29>
>
> ~Kelly, still pluggung, still shameless**
>
> I think it's only *shameless* promotion if you start telling us how
sexy
> the presenter is. <g>
>
> (And if this isn't the one that your husband is presenting, then
please
> delete my post from your memory.)
>
> Betsy

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] principles versus rules

messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/13/04 8:51:55 AM, ecsamhill@... writes:

<< I think it's only *shameless* promotion if you start telling us how sexy

the presenter is. <g>


<<(And if this isn't the one that your husband is presenting, then please

delete my post from your memory.) >>

BETSY!!
We don't tell *Kelly* we all think Ben is that way. Shhhh....
It's a matter of principle, y'know...

Sandra

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] principles versus rules
messages.msgSnippet: ** does  anyone have further reading on the principles versus  rules?
messages.messageBody:
** does anyone have further reading on the principles versus rules?<<<

There'll be a whole presentation about them at the upcoming Live & Learn
Unschooling Conference in Peabody, MA August 27-29, 2004.

_www.liveandlearnconference.org_ (http://www.liveandlearnconference.org)
<http://www.liveandlearnconference.org%29>

~Kelly, still pluggung, still shameless**

I think it's only *shameless* promotion if you start telling us how sexy
the presenter is. <g>

(And if this isn't the one that your husband is presenting, then please
delete my post from your memory.)

Betsy

messages.subject: Re: [UnschoolingDiscussion] principles versus rules
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 8/12/2004 11:50:53 AM Central Standard Time, jiangvelvet@hotmail.com writes: does  anyone have further reading on the principles versus
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 8/12/2004 11:50:53 AM Central Standard Time,
jiangvelvet@... writes:

does anyone have further reading on the principles versus rules?




~~
My favorite book on the subject is _Living Joyfully with Children_ by Win
and Bill Sweet.

It does a pretty good job of explaining the difference.

Karen
